message: I found vinyl again when I bought a pair of SL-1210's and nowadays I prefer analog records over spotify at home...
Is anybody here still listening music from vinyls?
@pimeys why?
Because of the record art and lots of tuning :)
like you own your music much more
i have an at-lp60
got it+polk audio rtia1's for christmas
Yeah, I love vinyl! I have an old turntable which was passed on to me from my dad, and I absolutely love it... I agree, the album art really makes it something special!
While my girlfriend and I will buy vinyl if we find a really good album, I'm ashamed to admit that we currently have no way of playing it. It's more for display purposes, I guess.
I still buy vinyl and about once a month a friend and i get together and go through our new buys. Good time
if Technics' vinyl player still in production, then it would still be alive... I wonder if not all, most DJs use their products (I mean vinyl DJs)
and you should buy one even if you're not a dj, it's a solid turntable for sure
I think it might still be
there are rumors that they don't make it anymore
at least there are lots of used ones in the market and that model still works after the nuclear holocaust
otherwise you need a separate speed changer or you always need to lift the plate to change the speed
@partlysean I used to own the same player :)
it's a good one if you have only 33 1/3 or 44.5 rpm records
an artist, I'll buy the record
Love listening to and collecting vinyl. Most of the music I listen to I have digitally, but if I really like
I play off this turntable (got the white one): http://www.project-audio.com/main.php?prod=debut&cat=turntables&lang=en
I usually listen my music from internet (spotify, torrent mp3, mixtapes etc) and buy all the good ones on vinyl
Vinyl is still alive. I just bought a Whitechapel vinyl and a In This Moment vinyl.

Yeah, actually, and it's extremely frustrating. I found this really underrated little garagr band from Portland online and after scouring the entire internet and no less than 20 affiliated music websites, I could only find it in 7". Which got me irked, because they're just SO exclusive that they just couldn't POSSIBLY bring themselves to put their tracks on ANYTHING but vinyl, because everything else is just so PAINFULLY mainstream. THANKS INDIE BITCHES BUT I DONT SEE HOW I COULD TRANSFER SOME FREAKING VINYL TO MY ITUNES, GOOD JOB ON BEING SO ESOTERIC.

I never owned a Vinyl player, but lately I find myself more and more attracted to getting one. Any pointers on a solid one with a reasonable price? (I'm no audiophile nitpicker that doesn't hear any difference between 128 & 192kps MP3s; so the player doesn't need to be tip notch ;)
I still buy vinyl, but it's usually because I want to give money to an artist, and find buying CDs unpalatable.
also vinyl usually comes with really nice insert art
